sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The harmony between the old and present non-conformists principles in relation to the terms of conformity, with respect both to the clergie, and the people : wherein a short history of the original of the English liturgy, and some reasons why several truly conscientious Christians cannot joyn with the church in it : humbly presented to publick consideration in order to the obtaining some necessary relaxation and indulgence : to which are added some letters that pass'd between the Lord Cecil, and Arch-bishop Whitgift. Lobb, Stephen, d. 1699. Whitgift, John, 1530?-1604. Burghley, William Cecil, Baron, 1520-1598.
[8], 96 p.
Printed and are to be sold by Joseph Collier ..., London : 1682.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======

Lobb, Stephen, d. 1699. Whitgift, John, 1530?-1604. Burghley, William Cecil, Baron, 1520-1598.
[8], 96 p.
Printed and are to be sold by Joseph Collier ..., London : 1682.
